I would highly recommend "The Hurt Locker" (2008) as a thrilling and poignant war movie.
Set during the Iraq War, the story revolves around Captain William Barnes (Jeremy Renner), who is newly assigned to an army bomb squad.
Barnes has a reputation for being maverick and reckless in his approach to his work.
However, when he meets his fellow squad members, including Lieutenant Thomas Jackson (Brian Geraghty)), he begins to see them in a different light.
Jackson, like Barnes, is seen as a bit of a maverick and reckless in his approach to his work.
But unlike Barnes, Jackson has a much more stable home life with his wife Sarah (Evangeline Lilly)) and two young children.
Jackson's home life gives him some perspective on the chaos and confusion that surrounds him when he's out at sea on his bomb squad.
Jackson's perspective on things helps him to see more clearly what is really going on around him.
This clarity in Jackson's perceptions allows him to make better decisions about how best to approach his work as a member of an army bomb squad.
As a result of all these factors, Captain William Barnes (Jeremy Renner)) finds himself at odds with his fellow squad members including Lieutenant Thomas Jackson (Brian Geraghty)), due to his reputation for being maverick and reckless in his approach to his work.
